meanings.definition: Originating in or characteristic of a distant foreign country.
meanings.sent1: The exotic spices from faraway lands added a unique flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The zoo had many exotic animals like zebras and kangaroos.
meanings.sent3: The exotic fruit salad made everyone at the party curious to try it.
meanings.sent4: Her exotic beauty stood out in the crowd like a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The exotic dance performance mesmerized the audience with its unfamiliar movements.

meanings.definition: Strikingly unusual or strange in effect or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The exotic painting caught everyone's attention with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The magician performed an exotic trick that left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The exotic hat she wore made her look like a character from a fantasy book.
meanings.sent4: His exotic choice of music for the party created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The exotic plant in the garden seemed to glow in the moonlight, creating a magical scene.

meanings.definition: Intriguingly unusual or different; excitingly strange.
meanings.sent1: The exotic idea of time travel fascinated the students in the science class.
meanings.sent2: The exotic perfume she wore had a captivating scent that lingered in the room.
meanings.sent3: The exotic mix of flavors in the new ice cream flavor surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His exotic collection of antique coins was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent5: The exotic language spoken by the visitors sounded like music to her ears.
